Start to build
Basic code that will help beginner to build any HTML page from scratch and also open it in WEB browser. Explained how to save file correctly.
html_content_01
To start to build a website we do not need any fancy programms and extra software. Any computer will be able to do the job, regardless its specifications.\n So we begin ...

Open Notepad (preinstalled on all Windows machines), icon on the left, or download Notepad ++, icon on the right. Believe it or not, that is basically the software that is used for creating most of the programms. Then add code below and save file as index.html. Or give any other name, but keep .html extention.

<html> 
 <title> </title> 
 <body> 

This is my first page 
 </body> 

</html>

Tables
Explanation of tables. \n How and where to use them, how to structure tables and make them invisible on a page. \n

Tables are used to arrange different information on a page, such as text or picturs and make design nice and clean. 
 Tables can be visible or invisible for a user. All that is done by setting table border parameters.
 Every table is made of table rows (tr) and table data(td). 
 By default table borders are invisible, but by adding "border = 1", border will apper. Number can vary, depending how you want your table to look like.

Other useful tags
Here I tried to put together other tags that will help to make page look better using separators, lines and other things like special characters.

Most pages use other elements there to separate content, add lines etc. \n Here is a list of these elements to help to make page look better. These tags can be inserted into text, around words, after paragraphs. Just anywhere where you feel like adding it.

tag is used to insert a horizontal break between two elements. If you want ot have a bigger break simply put few
one after another. \n For example

Lines can also be used as seperators of content.
 Horizontal line is added with <hr> tag. 
 By adding tag between two elemnts, next element will apper on the next line after the horizontal line. 
 By default line takes whole page length.
word 1 <hr> word 2

Next question you will have is how to add vertical line. \n There is no tag for doing that, but we can always modify our parameters for horizontal line to make it vertical.\n To do that we add extra styling parameters to our tag ...
<hr style="width:0.5px; height:50px; position: absolute; left: 35px;"/>
Here we added some parameters for line width and height. \n We alo positioned our line absolutely relatively to the left edge of the screen. \n Try to change it to right and see what will happen.
Special symbols

Sometimes we need to add some extra space between the words or special symbol. By defaul html will show only one space regardless how many are there in the code. But there is a way to add more by using 
 &nbsp. 
 If you want to see 10 spaces, add &nbsp 10 times( actually 9, as one space will be shown if exists in the code).
